fields.Name: Test MCP Connection
fields.Description: Tests connectivity to an MCP server and retrieves server information including name, version, capabilities, and connection latency. Use this action to verify an MCP server is reachable and responding correctly before attempting to execute tools.

fields.Name: ConnectionID
fields.Description: UUID of the MCP Server Connection to test. This should be a valid connection ID from the MCP Server Connections entity.

fields.Name: ServerName
fields.Description: Name of the MCP server as reported by the server itself.

fields.Name: ServerVersion
fields.Description: Version of the MCP server.

fields.Name: LatencyMs
fields.Description: Connection latency in milliseconds.

fields.Name: Capabilities
fields.Description: Server capabilities object indicating supported features (tools, resources, prompts, etc.).
Connection test succeeded. Server is reachable and responding.
Required ConnectionID parameter was not provided.
Failed to connect to the MCP server. Check server URL and network connectivity.
An unexpected error occurred during the connection test.

fields.Name: List MCP Tools
fields.Description: Retrieves the list of available tools from an MCP server connection. Returns tool names, descriptions, and input schemas for each tool. Use this action for discovery to understand what tools are available on a server before executing them.

fields.Name: ConnectionID
fields.Description: UUID of the MCP Server Connection to query for available tools.

fields.Name: Tools
fields.Description: Array of tool definitions. Each tool includes: name, description, and inputSchema (JSON Schema for parameters).

fields.Name: ToolCount
fields.Description: Total number of tools available on the server.
Successfully retrieved the list of tools from the MCP server.
Required ConnectionID parameter was not provided.
Failed to retrieve tools from the server. Connection may be unavailable.
An unexpected error occurred while listing tools.

fields.Name: Sync MCP Tools
fields.Description: Synchronizes tools from an MCP server to the local database. Discovers all available tools, adds new ones, updates existing tool definitions, and marks tools that are no longer available as deprecated. Use this action to keep the local tool catalog up to date with the server.

fields.Name: ConnectionID
fields.Description: UUID of the MCP Server Connection to synchronize tools from.

fields.Name: Added
fields.Description: Number of new tools added to the database.

fields.Name: Updated
fields.Description: Number of existing tools that were updated.

fields.Name: Deprecated
fields.Description: Number of tools marked as deprecated (no longer available on server).

fields.Name: Total
fields.Description: Total number of active tools after synchronization.
Tool synchronization completed successfully.
Required ConnectionID parameter was not provided.
Tool synchronization failed. Check connection and server availability.
An unexpected error occurred during tool synchronization.

fields.Name: Execute MCP Tool
fields.Description: Executes a tool on an MCP server. Connects to the server if not already connected, calls the specified tool with provided arguments, and returns the result. This is the primary action for invoking external tool capabilities through MCP.

fields.Name: ConnectionID
fields.Description: UUID of the MCP Server Connection to use for tool execution.

fields.Name: ToolName
fields.Description: Name of the tool to execute. Must match a tool name available on the server.

fields.Name: Arguments
fields.Description: Input arguments for the tool as a JSON object. The structure should match the tool's input schema.

fields.Name: Timeout
fields.Description: Request timeout in milliseconds. Default: 60000 (60 seconds).

fields.Name: ToolOutput
fields.Description: Array of content blocks returned by the tool. Each block has a type (text, image, etc.) and content.

fields.Name: StructuredOutput
fields.Description: Structured content returned by the tool, if available. This is the parsed/processed result.

fields.Name: DurationMs
fields.Description: Execution duration in milliseconds.

fields.Name: IsToolError
fields.Description: Boolean indicating whether the tool returned an error response (as opposed to a connection/protocol error).
Tool executed successfully and returned a result.
Required parameter (ConnectionID or ToolName) was not provided.
The tool executed but returned an error. Check the error message for details.
Tool execution failed due to connection or protocol error.
An unexpected error occurred during tool execution.
